security_audit.summary: All 66 static findings are false positives. The skill is a pure documentation resource containing markdown guides, templates, and placeholder scripts for ISO 13485 quality management compliance. Static analyzer misinterpreted quality management terminology, ISO clause numbers, and markdown syntax as security patterns. No executable code performs cryptographic operations, shell execution, or environment variable access.

content.value_statement: Medical device companies struggle to build and maintain compliant ISO 13485 quality management systems. This skill provides expert guidance on QMS implementation, documentation control, internal audits, and regulatory compliance for ISO 13485 certification.
actual_capabilities: Design and implement ISO 13485 compliant quality management systems
Establish document control processes following ISO 13485 Clause 4.2.3
Facilitate management review meetings per ISO 13485 Clause 5.6
Create internal audit programs aligned with ISO 13485 Clause 8.2.2
Integrate design controls and risk management (ISO 14971) into QMS
Prepare for ISO 13485 certification audits and regulatory inspections
limitations: Does not replace qualified ISO certification bodies for formal audits
Does not provide legal advice for regulatory submissions
Does not execute compliance checks on external systems
Templates require customization for specific organizational context

faq.question: What is ISO 13485?
faq.answer: ISO 13485 is the international standard for medical device quality management systems. It specifies requirements for organizations that need to demonstrate ability to provide medical devices and services that consistently meet customer and regulatory requirements.

faq.question: How long does ISO 13485 certification take?
faq.answer: Timeline varies by organization size and maturity. Initial certification typically takes 6-18 months. Annual surveillance audits and recertification every 3 years maintain the certification.

faq.question: What is the difference between ISO 9001 and ISO 13485?
faq.answer: ISO 13485 is tailored for medical devices with additional regulatory requirements, risk management emphasis, and documentation controls. ISO 9001 is a general quality management standard applicable to any industry.

faq.question: Does this skill perform compliance checks?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides expert guidance on QMS implementation and compliance approaches. Actual compliance verification requires certified auditors and formal assessment processes.

faq.question: What QMS processes does ISO 13485 require?
faq.answer: Core requirements include management responsibility, resource management, product realization, measurement, analysis, improvement, document control, and risk management integrated throughout all processes.

faq.question: Can this skill help with FDA compliance?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill covers FDA 21 CFR 820 (Quality System Regulation) alignment as part of regulatory interface management. This supports companies regulated by both ISO 13485 and FDA requirements.
